RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Claiming Purse 8700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 15, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligi bility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAD THE NOTION rated a short lead inside, kept the edge over SO RED THE ROSE through the backstretch, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole and dug in under steady handling to hold on. The latter stalked two deep, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and finished well at the outside poll of the winner. MOJO MATTERS settled in good striking position off the rail, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. UPSY DAISY DO saved ground, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. A BLONDE THING settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Had the Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,kept edge from 1/2,pressured 5/16,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Upsy Daisy Do
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 8700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 15, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAPPY CHAMP took the lead three wide into the first turn and rated the pace, drew clear of Spuntacular leaving the three eighths pole, was hand urged away from the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn, kept alert through the upper stretch then coasted the final sixteenth. FORT FORTITUDE raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and had to settle for second best. ELEVATED FOREVER rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and dueled through the stretch for third. CLOSE THE CASE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn, eased to the three path leaving the turn but was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. TOP HAT TREASON saved ground, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and passed rivals. SPUNTACULAR raced with the pace inside, gave close chase nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back past the pole and fade at the rail on the far turn. FIND YOUR BOAZ settled in the three and four paths on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MIAMI MUMBLES ducked out leaving the gate, raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole then weakened in the six path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Fortitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rauil,chased 1/2,off rail far turn,settled 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Spuntacular
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,chased 3/8,dropped back,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Miami Mumbles
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,3p 1st turn,chased 3/8,weakened 6p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 13100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In El igibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOBE'S GIRL took the nod leaving the half mile pole and set a pressured pace through the backstretch, drew off at the rail from the mid point of the turn and was kept alert in the lane. ULTIMATE BREEZE gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and cleared second later yards. SWEET SPIN chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. AT THE HALF gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly through the stretch. WATERLOO ROSE hopped at the break then gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and finished evenly to pass rivals. GOT YOUR NUMBER chased, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened in the lane. LADY LICIOUS chased the leaders, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the stretch. ALL WORKED UP pressured the pace through the backstretch but dropped back two deep midway on the turn and weakened inside the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Kobe's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,drew off rail near 1/8,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: All Worked Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,dropped back mid turn,weakened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 15 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consider ed In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FANCY HER UP broke clear and angled to the inside to show the way, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the turn near the rail and was steadily handled to hold on well. JACKS SISTER JILL chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, drifted leaving the turn but came back to finish well. EMBERLY chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. WHALE OF A TIME was bumped leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. MYSTIC MALIBU exchanged contact with ASUE leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the four path but showed little in the stretch. The latter exchanged contact with Mystic Malibu leaving the gate, was jostled against Whale Of A Time a stride later then gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and showed little in the lane.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ADARA saved ground well off the early pace, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, circled rivals in the five path on the far turn, dug in for the lead toward mid-stretch and drew off later yards. BET ON BITZ raced well off the pace in the three and four paths on the opening turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the five and six paths and finished well to take second the final strides. NOTIMELIKEPRESENT rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole and contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, but was met toward mid-stretch then nipped from second the final strides. DEVIL'S CANYON saved ground, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. CHERRYS CROSS raced well off the pace about the five path on the first turn, left the turn outside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the seven path and passed some rivals in the lane. MIMS HAT TRICK raced with the early pace three wide then stalked into the first turn, gave chase passing the half mile pole, contested even terms three wide on the far turn but flattened stride nearing mid-stretch. BUBBA G rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. MOSES WATER rated close in the three path on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and weakened. GRAND JURY became anxious in the gate, though raced with the early pace two deep, challenged nearing the three eighths pole, contested even terms between horses on the far turn but dropped back into the lane and weakened. TEMPTING MOMENT became anxious in the gate and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Notimelikepresent
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. David Richardson, North HanoverBloodstock & Empire Mak

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Jury
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious in gate,with early pace,challenged 3/8,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Bet On Bitz
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3& 4p,bid 3/8,5& 6p far turn,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Cherrys Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 5p,outside 1/2,chased 3/8,7p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Mims Hat Trick
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace,stalked,even terms 3wd far turn,flattened 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SENTELLA chased inside through the backstretch, raced blocked off the heels of Icy Stare at the rail through the turn, split horses into the lane, took over leaving the eighth pole and was kept alert to draw off. THE MONEY MACHINE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three and four paths, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to take second under the wire. CALERA LOVE came away awkwardly, gave chase inside through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn but drifted into the stretch and was nipped from second under the wire. ICY STARE was hustled up while angling in and set the pace, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn but gave up the lead passing the eighth pole and weakened in the lane. LATE NIGHT SPIRIT steadied after the start, picked up the chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and flattened in the lane. AMERICAN DREAMER gave chase and entered the turn off the rail, angled to the four path toward the top of the lane and passed some rivals. ESTILO AMOROSO came away awkwardly and in, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. POEM gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Sentella
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,blocked rail turn,split horses 1/8,drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Icy Stare
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 15 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 15 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,0 00 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HONEYQUIST took the lead leaving the chute and rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled to hold on well. FIZBO chased, raced in the three path through the turn then dueled through the stretch to take the late nod for second. EPIC TIME chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SETTLEMENT DATE came away a step slow and lacked a clear path through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. ENTRY TIME chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and ran evenly in the stretch. REMYS SHOWTIME chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. FROGGY THE GREMLIN gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Settlement Date
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,lacked clear path early,rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Honeyquist
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC Ultra Championship Racing LLC and Mill

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 15200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 15, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since December 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,5 00, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIERRO settled in the three path on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and closed to even terms in the three path midway on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn but dug in from the head of the lane, came between horses in deep stretch and got up the final yards. ELVIRUS raced well off the pace and off the rail the first turn, started a bid past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path, took the nod approaching the head of the lane, was carried out leaving the far turn and dug in under steady handling but was caught in the final yards. MY MIRACLE MAN settled just off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. WE B SHACKIN saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, angled widest into the lane and passed rivals. REY O REYES rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn but was met toward the head of the lane and flattened inside the eighth pole. JOHNNY SWISH saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. MI GUSTO ES tapered in and raced with the early pace two deep, challenged toward the three eighths pole but dropped back off the rail midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. BIG DADDY D R rounded the opening turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little response. BERNIE'S ON FIRE came away awkwardly, rounded the first turn in the four path and showed little response through the backstretch. PARISHIONER saved ground then faded through the backstretch. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Hierro for alleged interference leaving the far turn, lodged by the rider of Elvirus.

ENTRY.NAME: Rey O Reyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: We B Shackin
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,3p far turn,angled widest 1/8,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Elvirus
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,bid past 7/16,5p far turn,carried out 1/8,caught

ENTRY.NAME: Bernie's On Fire
ENTRY.OWNER: Bayne Jr William B and Super C Racing Inc
